text:
I am using Jmeter for load testing Weblogic server.I have set the class path in 
the enviranment and remote host ip addresses in the Jmeter properties file.I 
started the Jmeter-server.bat file for Jmeter-slave machines.I also started the 
Jmeter GUI on one of the Jmeter-slave machines to be used as a client.But when 
I start testing by clicking on the Remote start/Remote start all options 
present in the run menu,I am not able to get the results displayed in the 
listeners that i have used.Iam not even geting any error message or any results.
creator: chowdary.basha@mphasis.com

text:
if the system running jmeter-server is missing the necessary jar files, then
jmeter will have problems. are you adding any extra jar files in the classpath?
 if that is the case, you'll need to make sure the same exact jars are on all
systems.

peter
creator: woolfel@yahoo.com

text: Please re-open with details if this is still an error
creator: sebb@apache.org
